item.title: Branded GIF stickers on Instagram!
item.description: Did you know you can create your own branded GIF stickers?
item.dc:creator: Linyola
item.content:encoded:
Did you know you can create your own branded GIF sticker and make it accessible for everybody on Instagram? For example, if you gave your GIF sticker the tag 'Hardstyle' and visitors of your event are searching for GIF stickers about 'Hardstyle', they can use your branded GIF sticker in their Instagram Stories!

These are the steps you have to take to make your branded GIF sticker available on Instagram for everybody:

  1. Create or upload a GIF sticker on giphy.com
  2. Enter a source URL
  3. Decide on which search terms your GIF sticker has to be shown on Instagram and add these terms as tags.
  4. Push the 'Upload to GIPHY'-button.

item.title: Facebook Local
item.description: Facebook now helps people to discover bars, restaurants and nearby attractions with their standalone app Facebook Local (formerly known...
item.dc:creator: Linyola
item.content:encoded:
Facebook now helps people to discover bars, restaurants and nearby attractions with their standalone app Facebook Local (formerly known as Facebook Events app). Facebook Local combines events and permanent places to a single search engine powered by Facebook’s 70 million business pages plus reviews and friends’ check-ins.

Facebook Local is divided into 3 sections: The homescreen shows quick searches for restaurants or drinks, and a running list of events happening nearby that you might be interested in. You can also see which events your friends have expressed interest in, in case you want to tag along. Second, there’s a map and a search engine. You can search for "coffee" or "Thai food," sort by "open now”. The last section is your calendar.

If you're looking for the perfect dinner spot, all you have to do is click the "Restaurants" icon, and the app will populate a list of places nearby, along with their ratings and which of your Facebook friends have checked-in there in the past. So now your choice can be based on the recommendation of a friend, rather than a stranger's review. The app also appears to be an outcome for traveling people, Facebook Local lets you change your location to find out what’s happening in another city.

Want to learn more about Facebook Local? Then read this article.

item.title: IGTV - Instagram videos up to an hour!
item.description: Instagram is rolling out IGTV globally the next weeks! Instagram Television or IGTV is a new app for watching long-form, vertical video...
item.dc:creator: Linyola
item.content:encoded:
Instagram is rolling out IGTV globally the next weeks! Instagram Television or IGTV is a new app for watching long-form, vertical video from your favorite Instagram creators. While there’s a stand-alone IGTV app, you’ll also be able to watch from within the Instagram app so the entire community can use it from the very start. Unlike on Instagram, videos aren’t limited to one minute. Instead, each video can be up to an hour long.

As the name already gives away, IGTV is bringing features of Instagram and television together. Anyone can start a channel by uploading your own IGTV videos in the app or on the web.

Currently there are no immediate plans to pay for content on IGTV and advertising. But we expect to be seeing ads or some other kind of monetization of the feature within the next year or so. 

You can learn more about IGTV by visiting the Instagram Help Center.

Source: Instagram

item.title: Facebook testing AR Ads in News Feed
item.description: Facebook is getting into the augmented reality (AR) advertising business, entering a space previously dominated by Snapchat. Facebook...
item.dc:creator: Linyola
item.content:encoded:
Facebook is getting into the augmented reality (AR) advertising business, entering a space previously dominated by Snapchat.

Facebook announced that it would begin offering AR ads in the News Feed. People will be able to use their mobile device's camera to participate in the experiences.

One of the AR ad tests let people try on a pair of sunglasses virtually. “People now expect a personalized and visually inspiring experience wherever they shop — whether on their phone or in-store, which is why video will play an increasingly important role in the mobile shopping experience," is what Facebook's VP of product marketing said in a statement.

"In fact, we're already seeing video become the preferred medium for product discovery on mobile… We're excited to introduce new products that will help them both delight and inspire shoppers, and ultimately drive sales.”

Source: CNBC - full article here.

item.title: Share your Instagram Story to Facebook automatically
item.description: Instagram now has a feature whereby you can share your Instagram story on Facebook in just one click without leaving Instagram. This is...
item.dc:creator: Linyola
item.content:encoded:
Instagram now has a feature whereby you can share your Instagram story on Facebook in just one click without leaving Instagram.

This is how you can share all future Instagram stories on Facebook automatically:

  1. Go to your profile and tap the Settings-button in the top-right corner.
  2. Scroll down and tap Story Settings.
  3. Next to Share Your Story to Facebook, tap on the right side of the button. The button turns blue and that's all you have to do! Your future Instagram stories will now be posted automatically on Facebook too.

When you share your Instagram story to Facebook, it will appear as a story at the top of News Feed. Keep in mind that anything you share to Facebook, including your Instagram story, works with your existing Facebook privacy settings.

item.title: Approving Facebook ads with 'too much text in image'
item.description: Event posters, line-ups, timetables.. All visuals that require a lot of text. Visuals with over 20% text lose reach or will not be shown...
item.dc:creator: eefje982
item.content:encoded:
Event posters, line-ups, timetables.. All visuals that require a lot of text. Visuals with over 20% text lose reach or will not be shown by Facebook at all.

Do your ads keep getting disapproved by Facebook because they contain 'too much text in image’? There is a way to get those ads approved and running! If you are facing this problem, please contact us and we will help you out.

item.title: Three tips for influencer marketing
item.description: Social media usage is still increasing, so new opportunities in social media marketing constantly arise. Influencer marketing is one of...
item.dc:creator: Linyola
item.content:encoded:
Social media usage is still increasing, so new opportunities in social media marketing constantly arise. Influencer marketing is one of the channels that is gaining popularity. In this blog we hand you 3 tips that will help you become a real pro on influencer marketing. 

1. Be very selective

Regardless of the budget of your campaign, the focus of choosing the right influencers should always be on the match between brand and influencer. Quality ranks way and above quantity. Do your research properly and decide what kind of influencers are relevant to your niche. Then delve even deeper into each individual and the demographics of their audience: the highest ROI will come from an influencer who is as closely aligned to your brand as possible. Festival content is especially suitable for lifestyle and fashion influencers.

2. Use Micro-influencers

Influencer marketing doesn’t have to cost thousands of euro’s or dollars. Working with a handful of micro-influencers might deliver great results. All at a fraction of the cost of only one celebrity influencer. Furthermore, micro-influencers are scattered across industries. This means that there’s an influencer for every brand or industry!

3. Build a relationship to benefit on the long-term

Influencer marketing can not only be used to hype this year’s event; influencer content can also help to build on the festival’s image. When influencers attend an event and post about its highlights, they create enthusiasm for next year’s event. Through videos, pictures and words, they are able to make an event memorable, even to those who weren’t there. In short: next to the pre- and at-engagement, make sure you don't forget the post-engagement!

Starting with influencer marketing right now? We can help you choose the right influencers!
